text: application under s 191(5) of the life insurance act 1995 (cth) for dispensation from the requirements of s 191(2)(c)

scheme to transfer part of the life insurance business of one insurer to another
actuarial evidence suggested no disadvantage to policy holders

terms of insurance contracts not altered except beneficially for taxation and social security purposes

interests of policy holders are of primary concern

original scheme rejected for failing to accommodate valid concerns of objectors

nature of court's discretion to confirm scheme for transfer of life insurance business
